thread.title: Video: Vols football setting weight room records
thread.title_full: Video: Vols football setting weight room records

title: Video: Vols football setting weight room records
text:
Manage Video: Vols football setting weight room records The Tennessee football team still rings a bell in the weight room when any player sets a personal best. Apparently that bell has been ringing quite a bit lately. Slot to Tennessee Links Tennessee junior defensive lineman Jonathan Kongbo (Photo: Tennessee athletics, UTSports.com, VFL Films) 
The Tennessee football team still rings a bell in the weight room when any player sets a personal best. 
According to the latest video from VFL Films, that bell has been ringing quite a bit lately. 
(Want the latest scoop on Tennessee football and basketball? Make sure you're in the loop — take five seconds to sign up for our FREE Vols newsletter now!) 
Tennessee posted a video Saturday of several players setting personal bests in power clean lifts and ringing the bell, using the Twitter hashtag “#DOM1N8” and the slogan “YOUR TURN.” — Tennessee Football (@Vol_Football) February 25, 2017 
Several players — including senior tight end Jakob Johnson , redshirt freshman offensive lineman Ryan Johnson , senior cornerback Emmanuel Moseley , sophomore defensive tackle Quay Picou , senior kicker Aaron Medley , redshirt freshman offensive lineman Nathan Niehaus and junior defensive tackle Jonathan Kongbo — were shown lifting and ringing the personal-best bell. 
(Buy one month of GoVols247 VIP access and GET TWO MONTHS FREE .) 
Tennessee’s spring camp is scheduled to start March 21 and conclude with the Orange & White Game in Neyland Stadium on April 22.
